page.title: 01Gazetteer - Bromp on Swale
page.content: Brompton on Swale, an ancient village, lies in the centre of the D-block overshadowed by the new motorway A1(M). The East-West road runs from the county town of Northallerton up Swaledale. Branch railway lines to Catterick Garrison and Richmond are closed now. The area is predominantly dairy farming but does include new estates linked to the long established Garrison at Catterick. The motorway has enabled a number of industries to be established, the largest of which is the sand and gravel quarrying in the river flood plain which serves ARC Pipeline Construction. Angling on the river and the race course bring many visitors to the area.There are also facilities for camping and caravanning.
